intro: Mabrya geniculata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems and hairy, lobed leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Mabrya geniculata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
